excerpt: Early 1900s Buddhist monastery with several temples displaying ancient art & cultural artifacts.
detail_description: The Choijin Lama Temple Museum, located in downtown Ulaanbaatar, is a stunning Buddhist monastery built between 1904 and 1908. Once the residence of Luvsan Haidav Chiojin Lama, it now houses five temples showcasing ancient art and cultural artifacts. The ornate pagoda-style architecture stands out amidst the modern high-rise buildings surrounding it.
name: Choijin Lama Temple Museum
address: WW79+HH5 Genden St, SBD - 1 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14240, Mongolia

detail_description: Sukhbaatar Square stands as the vibrant heart of Ulaanbaatar, drawing in numerous visitors throughout the year. During the summer months from June to September, the main square in front of the Parliament Building is transformed with artificial turf, creating a serene space for relaxation and observing people. Additionally, a stage is set up during this period for free concerts, ceremonies, and various festivities that take place almost every day.
name: SUKHBAATAR SQUARE

excerpt: Ornate winter palace of a 1900s Mongolian emperor, with thousands of historical objects on display.
detail_description: The Bogd Khaan Palace Museum, once the winter residence of a 1900s Mongolian emperor, is now a museum showcasing thousands of historical artifacts. This ornate complex includes six temples with Buddhist artwork and thangka art. Visitors can explore the personal belongings of the last Bogd Khaan, such as his throne, bed, art collection, ceremonial ger (yurt), and jewelry. The museum also presents theories about the king's death and displays original outfits and furniture.
name: Bogd Khaan Palace Museum
address: Bogd Khaanii Ordon, HUD - 19 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 17040, Mongolia

excerpt: Buddhist monastery complex featuring sacred temples & a 25-m. gold Megjid Janraisig statue.
detail_description: Gandantegchinlen Monastery, also known as Gandan Monastery, is a significant Buddhist complex in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Originally consisting of over 100 temples and monasteries serving a population of 50,000, it faced destruction during religious purges in the late 1930s. However, since the early 1990s, Buddhism has been openly practiced again in Mongolia.
name: Gandantegchinlen Monastery

excerpt: Museum with extensive artifacts & antiquities tracing Mongolia's history, ethnography & culture.
detail_description: The National Museum of Mongolia, also known as Монголын Үндэсний Музей, is a treasure trove of artifacts and antiquities that offer a comprehensive journey through Mongolia's rich history, ethnography, and culture. From Neolithic relics to contemporary exhibits, the museum provides an unparalleled insight into Mongolian heritage.
name: National Museum of Mongolia
address: Travel St 1, CHD - 4 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 15160, Mongolia

excerpt: Riddles, puzzles, games & artifacts are the draw at this unique museum with a giant chess set.
detail_description: The International Intellectual Museum, located in downtown UB, is a unique and playful collection of riddles, puzzles, games, and artifacts from around the world. Established in 1990 by a local toymaker, Tumen-Ulzii, this privately-owned museum showcases traditional Mongolian logic puzzles and other magical games. The museum's specialty is the traditional Mongolian logic puzzle that requires knowledge of physics to solve. Visitors can also enjoy a giant chess set on the premises.
name: International Intellectual Museum

detail_description: If you're on the hunt for a vibrant shopping experience in Ulaanbaatar, look no further than Narantuul Market. This bustling bazaar, often referred to as the "Black Market," is a treasure trove of traditional clothing, horse riding gear, and unique souvenirs that capture the essence of Mongolian culture.
name: Narantuul Market

excerpt: Venerable museum known for works by G. Zanabazar, plus other historical pieces by Mongolian artists.
detail_description: The Fine Arts Zanabazar Museum, established in 1966, is a revered institution dedicated to the renowned Mongolian artist G. Zanabazar and other historical pieces by Mongolian artists. The museum showcases Zanabazar's intricately sculpted brass statues of Buddhist deities and the Bodhi Stupa, along with artwork from the 18th to 20th centuries.
name: Zanabazar Museum of Fine Arts
address: Sambuu St, Art Museum, CHD - 4 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 15170, Mongolia

detail_description: Zaisan Hill Complex, situated in the southern part of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, is a significant memorial honoring Soviet soldiers who fought in World War II. The complex features a circular mural depicting historical moments such as Soviet support for Mongolian independence and victory over Nazi Germany. Apart from its historical significance, Zaisan Hill offers stunning panoramic views of the city and the surrounding natural beauty. Visitors can also enjoy the illuminated sight of the towering Zaisan Memorial against the night sky.
name: Zaisan Hill Complex
address: Khan-Uul District, 11th khoroo, Dunjingarav 14 Ulaanbaatar, 17023, Mongolia

excerpt: Compact paleontology museum offering exhibits of dinosaur fossils, artifacts & educational programs.
detail_description: The Natural History Museum of Mongolia, situated in the heart of Ulaanbaatar near Sukhbaatar Square, is a compact yet impressive paleontology museum. It boasts a diverse collection of artifacts and fossils that trace Mongolia's history from the Stone Age to modern times.
name: The Natural History Museum of Mongolia
address: L.Laagan's St, CHD - 5 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 15141, Mongolia

excerpt: Indoor & outdoor children's games & rides are the draw at this popular, lakefront amusement park.
detail_description: The National Amusement Park, situated in the heart of Ulaanbaatar, is a popular destination for families with young children. Established in 1965, it has undergone significant expansion and modernization over the years. The park features a variety of indoor and outdoor attractions including amusement rides, paddle boats, and entertainment shows. In addition to traditional rides like carousels and a pirate ship, the park also offers a cinema, shooting range, sports ground, and fairy-tale sculptures.
name: National Amusement Park

excerpt: Popular urban park offering athletic fields & courts, open green space, a playground & picnic area.
detail_description: Gorkhi Terelj National Park, located about 37 kilometers from Ulaanbaatar city center, is a picturesque destination in Mongolia. The park offers stunning natural features such as unique rock formations like Turtle Rock and the Old Man Reading a Book, as well as Khagiin Khar Lake and Yestii Hot Water Springs. Visitors can also enjoy activities like hiking and exploring the beautiful glacial lake. Additionally, the park provides facilities for picnics and other recreational activities.
name: National Park

excerpt: National art gallery housing contemporary & modern paintings, crafts, sculptures & prints.
detail_description: The Mongolian National Art Gallery, located in Ulaanbaatar's Palace of Culture, was established in 1991 and is dedicated to showcasing Mongolian visual arts. The gallery features regular exhibitions of classic and contemporary artwork, including a permanent collection of paintings, sculptures, and carvings. Notable pieces include Tsevegjav Ochir's famous realist painting 'The Fight of the Stallions.'
name: Mongolian National Art Gallery
address: D. Sukhbaatar Sq 3, STB-B Building, SBD - 8 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 13361, Mongolia

excerpt: Considered to be sacred, this protected, natural peak features hiking trails & views of the city.
detail_description: Bogd Khan Mountain, located in Altai Tavan Bogd National Park, is a sacred and protected natural peak offering picturesque hiking trails and stunning views of Ulaanbaatar. The 6.5km track up the mountain provides an opportunity to experience the beauty of larch and cedar forests, along with sightings of playful squirrels.
name: Bogd Khan Mountain

detail_description: The Chingis Khaan Statue is a prominent landmark located in the central square of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. The statue depicts Chinggis Khaan on horseback and is accompanied by large colonnade monuments to Ogodei Khaan and Khubilai Khaan.
name: Chingis Khaan Statue

detail_description: Located just a short walk from Sukhbaatar Square, the State Opera and Ballet Academic Theatre in Ulaanbaatar is a stunning example of Neoclassical architecture. Since its establishment in 1963, the theater has showcased over 100 national and international productions, including iconic operas like Verdi's La traviata and ballets such as Tchaikovsky's Swan Lake.
name: State Opera and Ballet Academic Theatre
address: WW99+CVM Сүхбаатарын талбайн гудамж, SBD - 8 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14200, Mongolia

detail_description: Sukhbaatar Square, located in the center of Ulaanbaatar, is a historic site where Mongolia declared its final independence from China in 1921. The square features a bronze statue of Damdin Sukhbaatar, a revolutionary hero astride his horse. It was later renamed Chinggis Khaan Square but restored to its original name after a court battle in 2016. Nearby attractions include the National Museum of Mongolia History and the Chinggis Khan Statue.
name: Sukhbaatar Square

detail_description: The Mongolian Military Museum, also known as the Museum of the Mongolian Armed Forces, is a lesser-known gem in Ulaanbaatar. While it may be off the beaten path, it's a worthwhile stop for history enthusiasts and especially veterans. The museum focuses on Mongolia's struggle for freedom and independence, offering insights into the country's sacrifices and its perspective as a satellite state of the Soviet Union.
name: Mongolian Military Museum
address: Монгол цэргийн музей, BZD - 4 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 13343, Mongolia

detail_description: The Parliament of Mongolia, situated in the capital city Ulan Bator, is a significant landmark with a rich history. It has been located in its current place since 1951 and serves as the office for the President and other government officials. The building houses conference halls, chambers, and an impressive collection of artwork including paintings and sculptures. Notably, it features a striking statue of Genghis Khan seated on a throne.
name: Parliament of Mongolia

detail_description: Immerse yourself in the rich cultural heritage of Mongolia with a visit to the Tumen-Ekh Folk Song and Dance Ensemble. This ensemble offers a captivating one-hour performance featuring traditional music, dance, throat singing, and mesmerizing contortion acts. The contortionists' incredible flexibility is sure to leave you spellbound, while the enchanting melodies and vibrant dances showcase the country's artistic traditions. Don't miss this opportunity to witness an unforgettable display of Mongolian performing arts.
name: Tumen-Ekh Folk Song and Dance Ensemble

excerpt: Ulaanbaatar is the capital of Mongolia. It’s in the Tuul River valley, bordering the Bogd Khan Uul National Park. Originally a nomadic Buddhist center, it became a permanent site in the 18th century. Soviet control in the 20th century led to a religious purge. Soviet-era buildings, museums within surviving monasteries, and a vibrant conjunction of traditional and 21st-century lifestyles typify the modern city.
detail_description: Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia, is located in the Tuul River valley and borders the Bogd Khan Uul National Park. Once a nomadic Buddhist center, it transitioned into a permanent settlement in the 18th century. The city reflects a blend of traditional and modern lifestyles with Soviet-era buildings and museums housed within surviving monasteries. The National Garden Park, covering 23% of the city's green space, offers various environmental services and recreational activities.
name: Ulaanbaatar

excerpt: Iconic monument above the city remembering soldiers of Mongolia & the USSR lost in WWII.
detail_description: Zaisan Monument, located in the southern area of Ulaanbaatar city, is a significant memorial honoring Soviet soldiers who lost their lives in World War II. The monument features striking socialist realism imagery with Soviet mosaics and reliefs, including depictions of Stalin and Lenin. Visitors can access the monument via a steep climb of over 500 steps and are rewarded with panoramic views of Ulaanbaatar and its surrounding hills.
name: Zaisan Monument

excerpt: Large department store featuring clothing, electronics, accessories, homewares & food options.
detail_description: Located in the heart of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, the State Department Store is a six-story shopping destination offering a wide range of products. From clothing and electronics to accessories, homewares, and food options, this department store has something for everyone. Visitors can find high-quality cashmere goods as well as traditional handicrafts such as toys, jewelry, and Kazakh wall hangings at Mary & Martha Mongolia within the store.
name: State Department Store

detail_description: The Chinggis Khaan National Museum is a part of the rich cultural heritage in Mongolia. It's one of the many museums in the area, offering visitors a chance to explore Mongolian history and traditions. The museum features modern exhibits that cover various aspects of Mongolia's past, not just focusing on Chinggis Khaan. However, some visitors have noted that the lack of English descriptions can be a drawback, but there are QR codes available for translation.
name: Genghis Khan National Museum Mongolia
address: Sambuu St Huvisgalchdiin urgun chuluu, CHD - 4 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 15141, Mongolia

detail_description: The National Sports Stadium in Mongolia is a standard venue for various festivals, including the Naadam festival. It hosts bigger concerts and national holiday events, offering a traditional festival experience with cultural aspects. The atmosphere during busy times is fantastic, with people of all ages and social backgrounds joining. The stadium's opening ceremony for the Naadam festival features dance, music, and performances, creating an eye-opening experience despite potential weather challenges. Outside the stadium, there are numerous food vendors to explore during events.
name: National Sports Stadium

detail_description: Tasgany Ovoo is a significant site in Mongolia, associated with the renowned Gandan Monastery. While the actual ovoo has been taken down, the hill where it stood remains. It offers a peaceful escape from the hustle and bustle of Ulaanbaatar, allowing visitors to gain some perspective and tranquility amidst the city's traffic.
name: Tasgany Ovoo

detail_description: Khongoryn Els tour company offers an unforgettable experience at the renowned Khongoryn Els sand dunes, located 280 kilometers west of Ulaanbaatar. These majestic dunes are part of the Mongol Els and cover an impressive stretch of 80 kilometers in length and about 5 kilometers in width. Visitors can immerse themselves in a picturesque and diverse landscape, encompassing a vibrant blend of steppe, mountains, forests, and desert.
name: Khongoryn Els tour company
address: WW64+H4V Seoul St, SBD - 3 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14252, Mongolia

excerpt: Museum exhibiting the history of Ulaanbaatar since the 1600s in a cozy space with a bright exterior.
detail_description: Ulaanbaatar City Museum is a cozy space with a bright exterior, exhibiting the history of Ulaanbaatar since the 1600s. It features displays of a Tarbosaurus bataar and a massive long-necked Opisthocoelicaudia in an incongruous location within a mall. The museum showcases the development of UB city through lots of pictures, providing insight into the historical eras with well-divided information.
name: Ulaanbaatar City Museum
address: WW9P+8CF Peace Avenue, BZD - 15 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 13370, Mongolia

detail_description: Dashchoilin Monastery is one of the three remaining monasteries of its kind in Mongolia, originally built in 1890. It used to be a significant religious site in Ulaanbaatar, accommodating up to 600 lamas or monks. However, it ceased its activities and was destroyed in 1938 due to government pressure.
name: Dashchoilin Monastery
address: N.Sodnom St, SBD - 8 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14193, Mongolia

detail_description: Luna Blanca Restaurant, which opened in 2008 as the second vegan restaurant in Mongolia, has since become one of around 25 restaurants in the country catering specifically to the vegan diet. Co-owned by Altanzaya and Ariunaa, it is considered a social enterprise aimed at promoting healthier diets in Mongolia.
name: Luna Blanca Restaurant
address: Sukhbaatar St 11, CHD - 1 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 15160, Mongolia

detail_description: Veranda, located in Ulaanbaatar, is a renowned Mediterranean and Italian restaurant that has been serving high-quality dishes since 2006. The cozy atmosphere and excellent service make it a popular choice for locals and visitors alike. The menu features delectable options such as the 30 Days Dry Aged T-Bone Steak, Moroccan soup, steak salad, salmon soup, and ravioli with beef and mushrooms.
name: Veranda
address: WW88+3X6 С.Жамъян Гүнгийн Гудамж, SBD - 1 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14240, Mongolia

detail_description: Nestled in Ulaanbaatar, the Fat Cat Jazz Club is a cozy and intimate spot perfect for jazz enthusiasts. Founded by a local musician, this underground gem offers nightly live jazz performances and an impressive selection of cocktails. Located just south of Sukhbaatar Square, it's a trendy and popular music club known for its fantastic atmosphere. Whether you reserve a table or pull up to the bar, you're in for an unforgettable night filled with soulful music and original drinks.
name: Fat Cat Jazz Club Ulaanbaatar
Sukhbaatar Square
address: Peace Avenue, SBD - 1 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14240, Mongolia

detail_description: The National University of Mongolia stands as a vibrant hub of learning and innovation, bustling with the energy of young Mongolians eager to shape their nation's future. As you stroll through its grounds, you'll encounter the iconic Statue of Khorloogiin Choibalsan, a historical figure symbolizing Mongolia's past and progress. This esteemed institution is celebrated for its academic excellence and has received prestigious honors like the Order of Sukhbaatar.
name: National University of Mongolia

detail_description: Nestled just southwest of the Victims of Political Persecution Memorial Museum, the Wedding Palace stands out with its large, white square structure. This unique venue operates like a well-oiled machine, hosting up to eight weddings in a single day. It offers an all-inclusive experience that encompasses everything from stunning photography to the ceremony itself, making it a popular choice for couples looking to celebrate their love in true Mongolian style.
name: Wedding Palace
address: WW7C+M2V Genden St, SBD - 1 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 14240, Mongolia

detail_description: Egshiglen is a small musical instrument store that specializes in Tibetan, Mongolian, and other ethnic instruments. The saleswoman has a good knowledge of music and can recommend the right instrument for you. If you're looking for an ethnic instrument, this is the place to go.
name: Egshiglen

detail_description: This is a small English-language book store in the center of Ulaanbaatar. It has a wide selection of new and used books, as well as magazines and a few books in other languages.
name: Books in English Bookstore /англи номын дэлгүүр
address: Peace Avenue 62, SBD - 4 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia

detail_description: Galleria Ulaanbaatar, situated in the heart of the city near the main square, offers an exceptional shopping experience in Mongolia. The mall features a large cashmere store, a diverse souvenir shop, and various restaurants serving both local and international cuisines. Visitors can also enjoy breathtaking views of the city from this location. Gobi Cashmere is a prominent presence within the mall.
name: Galleria Ulaanbaatar

detail_description: The Hunnu Mall is a great place to hang out with friends. It has a lot of different stores, each of which offers something unique. The store must check is a great place to buy clothes, accessories, and food.
name: Hunnu Mall
address: VVH2+9FV Яармагийн зам, The Hunnu Shopping Centre, HUD - 24 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 17110, Mongolia

detail_description: The shopping mall UB Mart features a good layout, but the parking is very bad. It's ideal for shoppers on foot or by bike.
name: UB Mart Shopping Center

detail_description: When exploring Ulaanbaatar, a visit to the EVSEG Cashmere Factory Store is a must for any cashmere enthusiast. Nestled in the industrial area, this store boasts an impressive selection of high-quality cashmere products including scarves, hats, sweaters, and blankets. The atmosphere is clean and well-maintained, with friendly staff ready to assist you in finding the perfect piece.
name: EVSEG Cashmere Factory Store
address: VWW4+87X Богд Жавзандамба хутагтын гудамж, HUD - 19 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 17040, Mongolia

detail_description: Nestled in a luxurious apartment complex on the northeastern side of Khan-Uul District, the Marshal Art Gallery is a vibrant addition to Ulaanbaatar's cultural landscape since its opening in May 2013. This modern gallery not only showcases an impressive array of artworks from both local and international artists but also fosters creativity through various arts education programs and social activities aimed at supporting artistic endeavors in Mongolia.
name: Marshal Art Gallery
address: Olympic Street, King Tower, HUD - 17 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar, 17012, Mongolia

excerpt: Threatened species of deer & hare can be seen in this expanse of taiga forest, tundra & grassland.
detail_description: The Bogd Khan Uul Strictly Protected Area is a national park that features a vast expanse of taiga forest, tundra, and grassland. This area is home to various species of deer and hare that are currently under threat. Despite this, visitors to the park can still observe these animals in their natural habitat. The conservation efforts within the park aim to preserve these endangered species while also maintaining the balance of the ecosystem as a whole.
name: Bogd Khan Mountain National Park

detail_description: CHoco Metropolis Club is a night club with a unique and extravagant design. The interior of the club is decorated in the style of 1920s Berlin, and features an extensive liquor menu.
name: CHOCO CLUB ULAANBAATAR

detail_description: Tsetsee Gun, the peak of Bogd Khan Mountain in Ulaanbaatar, is a magnet for adventurous souls. The hike to this sacred peak offers stunning views and a chance to get closer to Tengger, Mongolia's sky god. The trail starts from the south side and leads hikers through challenging terrain with fallen trees, water streams, mud, and rocky sections. A local guide rates the route as moderately difficult.
name: Tsetsee Gun
address: BZD - 11 khoroo, Bogdain Khid, Ulaanbaatar 13201, Mongolia

detail_description: The Red Ger Gallery is a prominent destination for contemporary art enthusiasts, showcasing the works of leading Mongolian painters. The gallery hosts frequent exhibitions, offering a diverse collection of modern artwork.
name: Red Ger Gallery
address: #402 Delta center, Tourist street Ulaanbaatar, 15170, Mongolia

detail_description: Nestled near the National Sport Stadium and the Winter Palace of the Bogd Khan, the Camel Caravan Statue stands as a striking symbol in Ulaanbaatar. This remarkable monument celebrates the rich heritage of camel herders and nomadic families from the Gobi Desert, who have traversed these lands for generations along the historic Silk Road. As you stroll along Chinggis Avenue after crossing the Peace Bridge, keep an eye out for this impressive statue that captures both history and culture in its artistic form.
name: Camel Caravan Statue

detail_description: Perched on top of Bondkhan Uul at an elevation of 1620 meters, Khurel Togoot Planetarium 1 is a Soviet-era observatory that provides stunning panoramic views of the city. It's a great spot for astrology enthusiasts to indulge in stargazing and observe celestial bodies. Additionally, it's an ideal location for families to enjoy a leisurely picnic while taking in the breathtaking scenery.
name: Khurel Togoot Planetarium 1
address: Sky Resort Rd, BZD - 11 khoroo, Ulaanbaatar 13240, Mongolia

detail_description: Located within a shopping mall, the Centre of Shaman Eternal Heavenly Sophistication is an unconventional dinosaur museum. Visitors can marvel at the impressive displays featuring a Tarbosaurus bataar and the massive long-necked Opisthocoelicaudia.
name: Centre of Shaman Eternal Heavenly Sophistication
